thread.title: Marathon Oil upgraded to Buy at Argus on strong financials, shareholder focus
thread.title_full: Marathon Oil upgraded to Buy at Argus on strong financials, shareholder focus

author: Carl Surran, SA News Editor
title: Marathon Oil upgraded to Buy at Argus on strong financials, shareholder focus
text:
Marathon Oil (NYSE:
MRO) +1.3% in Thursday's trading as Argus upgrades the stock to Buy from Hold with a $31 price target, pointing to the company's strong financial foundation, underscored by low debt levels and robust free cash flow yields.
Marathon's (
MRO) shareholder-oriented strategies, including consistent dividend increases and share repurchase programs, are supported by a three-year history of strong operational performance and growth in shareholder value, Argus analyst Bill Selesky says. Last month, Marathon ( MRO) reported Q4 adjusted earnings of $406M, or $0.69/share, down from $563M, or $0.88/share, in the year-earlier quarter, reflecting lower realized commodity prices for crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids.
For FY 2024, the company expects total production of 380K-400K net boe/day, down from 405K net boe/day in 2023, with capital spending of $1.9B-$2.1B, compared to $2.03B in 2023.
Argus lowers its 2024 EPS estimate to $2.58 from $3.51 previously to reflect weak Q4 results and its 2024 WTI crude oil price forecast of $80/bbl.
